text: Table | Five stages of clinical risk management Risk awareness: hospital care constitutes a complex system and that this complexity brings risk Risk identification: a process for identifying specific risks in a particular set of circumstances. This can be either retrospective or prospective Risk assessment: an assessment of the magnitude of a particular risk, how likely it is to result in a particular outcome and the impact of that outcome on the patient(s) Risk management: the development of plans and strategies to minimize identified risks to tolerable levels Re-evaluation: a continuous process whereby risks are reviewed with the aim of developing safer systems
